page_content:
August 1 – Application Opens
The University of California Application opens for the academic term beginning next Fall.

October 1 - December 2 – Submit Your Fall 2025 Application
Submit the University of California Application by the December 2 deadline.

October – FAFSA and California Dream Act Open
FAFSA and California Dream Act applications open. Only complete one.
• U.S. citizens and permanent residents: Complete FAFSA, use IRS data retrieval for tax information.
• Non-U.S. citizens: Complete California Dream Act Application if you are a California resident not eligible for FAFSA who attended a CA High School for 3 years or more and will or have already graduated (AB540 eligible).

metadata.title: FAFSA and California Dream Act Open

page_content:
December – Applicant Portal
Upon receipt of their application, applicants will receive an email invitation to the Applicant Portal with login instructions. Make sure you check all email folders to ensure you are receiving emails from us and they are not being marked as spam.

January 31 – Complete Your Transfer Academic Update
You must log in to your application and complete the Transfer Academic Update.

April 2 – File Your FAFSA or California Dream Act Application
File your FAFSA or California Dream Act application. Forms are also available from your school counselor. Applications are reviewed on a first-come, first-served basis. See Financial Aid timeline for more details.
• List UC San Diego school code 001317 on your application.
• Meet the April 2 deadline to be considered for the best possible funding.
• Apply for a Cal Grant.

metadata.title: File Your FAFSA or California Dream Act Application

page_content:
By April 30 – Transfer Admission Decisions Posted
Transfer admission decisions will be posted on the Applicant Portal.

May 9 – Appeals for Applicants Not Admitted
Every application to UC San Diego is reviewed thoroughly. Admission decisions are made carefully to meet the enrollment goals of the university. Therefore, successful appeals are very rare. Applicants who have new and compelling academic information that was not presented in their original application, may submit an appeal through their Applicant Portal by May 9 No appeals will be accepted after the deadline.

May 15 – Applicants invited to join the Waitlist
Select applicants will be invited to opt in to our waitlist through their Applicant Portal. Transfer applicants must opt in to the waitlist by 11:59 p.m. (PT) on May 15. Being on the waitlist does not guarantee an offer of admission. We strongly urge students to accept another university's admission offer before the appropriate deadline to ensure they have secured a spot at an institution. By July 31, final decisions will be released to applicants who opt in to the waitlist.

metadata.title: Applicants invited to join the Waitlist

page_content:
June 1 – Deadline to Accept UC San Diego's Offer of Admission
Accept your offer through the Applicant Portal.

metadata.title: Deadline to Accept UC San Diego's Offer of Admission

page_content:
July 1 – Deadline to Submit Your Final Transcripts
• Submit all official college and/or university transcripts. You do not need to submit a high school transcript if you satisfied the American History & Institution requirement with college-level coursework or by earning a 3 or higher on the AP U.S. History exam. If you attended high school outside of the U.S., an official transcript is not required.
• Refer to Required Documents from Schools Outside the United States if any of your coursework was taken outside the U.S.

metadata.title: Deadline to Submit Your Final Transcripts

page_content:
July 15 – AP and IB Exam Results Due
AP and IB exam results are due no later than July 15.
• Please request results be sent to UC San Diego, school code: 004836.
• For more information, please refer to the Advanced Placement FAQs.

metadata.title: AP and IB Exam Results Due

page_content:
